Section.Title: Use in Cancer

ItemizedList.ListItem: Acute myeloid leukemia that is newly diagnosed. It is used in adults aged 75 years and older or adults who cannot be treated with intensive induction chemotherapy. It is given with either azacitidine, decitabine, or low-dose cytarabine.
Chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) or small lymphocytic lymphoma (SLL) in adults. It may be given alone or with either obinutuzumab or rituximab.

Section.Para: Venetoclax is also being studied in the treatment of other types of cancer.
